column4: ok im reading the grub2 info ... and i see the read only files all im trying to do is make windows my default instead of ubuntu and remove a now defunct copy of ubuntu from the list.. where do i start
to remove old kernel from grub just remove them from synaptic
have you tried installing the backports modules wireless to see if a newer driver makes a difference ?
no i'm unaware how to as well plz advise
if the name did not change should be  --> sudo apt-get install linux-backports-modules-wireless-maverick-generic
downloading now, hopefully i get it b4 network crashes again.. its goin kinda slow.
dropped before network finished doing its thing is there a way to download backports on a usb and then transfer?
packages.ubuntu.com but you will have to dwonload the package that matches your ernel version
also apt-get can resume downloads. so you can retry
do "uname -a" to see your exact kernel version
you know im noticing something.. if i don't try to download anything via the apt or "activate" my video card driver thats when my network stops..
that's weird; thse things shouldn't affect the connection
100% agreed. however, i ran for quite some time on just netscape.. even transmitted data no problems. i went to install backend, it said it had to transfer 30MB and i lost connectivity..
just tested again.. i stayed connected for a while.. was surfing no problems.. i used "Ubuntu software center" got some random package and poof no more net.
